newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Mar leading index 30.0, coincident 80.0 - EPA.
newsitem.headline: Japan Mar leading index 30.0, coincident 80.0 - EPA.

text.p: Japan's diffusion index of leading economic indicators stood at 30.0 on a scale of 100 in March, the Economic Planning Agency (EPA) said on Friday.
The EPA said in a statement that economic recovery remains intact despite slight weakness seen in the index of leading indicators.
A breakdown of the indices of economic indicators follows:
The index of leading indicators was below 50 for a third successive month in March.
The index of coincident indicators was above 50 for the seventh month in a row, while the lagging indicators index was at 50 after standing below 50 for two straight months.

A figure below 50, the so-called "boom or bust" mark, for the index of leading economic indicators is generally taken as suggesting the economy will contract in the coming months, while a figure above 50 suggests the economy will expand.
The coincident index measures current economic conditions, while the lagging index traces economic trends in the past few months.
